articles.description: Sam Burns maintains slender lead but Adam Scott, JJ Spaun and Viktor Hovland are in pursuit after intriguing third day at the US Open.
articles.title: US Open 2025: Sam Burns leads, Scott, Spaun, Hovland, Hatton and MacIntyre among chasers

articles.description: The Club World Cup gets under way in the US as Inter Miami play out a goalless draw against Al Ahly.
articles.title: Club World Cup: Lionel Messi and heavy security open tournament

articles.description: Mercedes' George Russell beats Max Verstappen to pole position for the Canadian Grand Prix in Montreal.
articles.title: Canadian Grand Prix: George Russell snatches Canada pole from Max Verstappen

articles.description: Rory McIlroy describes his performance at the US Open as "pretty average" as he shot a 74 on Saturday to fall back to 10 over.
articles.title: US Open 2025: Rory McIlroy 'keen to see his week end' after 'frustrating' Oakmont tournament

articles.description: South Africa's players show their mettle to ignore sledges from Australia's players as they go from chokers to World Test champions at Lord's.
articles.title: South Africa ignore Australia's 'choke' sledges at Lord's to win ICC World Test Championship final

articles.description: England's Luke Humphries and Luke Littler are out of the World Cup of Darts after a shock defeat by hosts Germany in the last 16.
articles.title: World Cup of Darts: England suffer shock defeat by Germany to go out

articles.description: Max Verstappen says Formula 1 is "annoying" and that questions about him racing under the threat of a race ban were "childish".
articles.title: Canadian Grand Prix: Max Verstappen says questions about potential race ban 'childish' and 'annoying'

articles.description: German qualifier Tatjana Maria says it is a "dream come true" to reach the final of Queen's after stunning Australian Open champion Madison Keys.
articles.title: Queen's 2025: Qualifier Tatjana Maria stuns Madison Keys to reach final

articles.description: Bath captain Ben Spencer says the "sky is the limit" for the club after they ended a 29-year wait for a Premiership trophy.
articles.title: Bath Premiership title: Captain Ben Spencer says 'sky is limit' after side's glory

articles.description: Leinster win the United Rugby Championship for the first time since 2021 as they produced a dominant display to beat Bulls 32-7 at Croke Park.
articles.title: Leinster 32-7 Bulls: Leinster ease past Bulls to win ninth URC title
